instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787A: What is 820-3787A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: Gday guys I'm using schematics for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> so hope layout is similar. unit has corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C8513</CAPACITOR> PP1V5R1V35_S0GPU would this cause no backlight? because I wouldn't think so unless this rail must be complete before backlight shows up. or is it as simple as replace backlight driver? I'm getting 0.560 Diode on L9000. I'm not 100% familiar with this retina model so any help would be great. I'm getting 12v on both sides of the fuse.

threads.message: Yeah get the correct schematic first. What voltage do you get on BKLT output on the bigger BKLT caps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: there is 0v on backlight output. yes i can see an image but not backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at pin 1/J8300 w/ and w/ LCD connected; no power applied, of course.
Also check if F7700 is OK.

Post voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, pins 5, 18, 17, 11; LCD connected this time.
Be sure to have continuity from <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> to <RESISTOR>R7708</RESISTOR>/09.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7708</RESISTOR>/09 have cont. <RESISTOR>R7709</RESISTOR> is 16K it should be 150K is this the feedback?

F7700 is fine

J8300 P1 with lcd on is 0.033 Diode mode
J8300 P1 w/o lcd is 1.149 Diode mode

<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> P1 -0.060 P2 -0.060 P3 12V P4 12,3V P5 0.060 P6 0.060

Hope this helps

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> voltages P5 OV P11 11.93V P17 0V P18 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7743</RESISTOR>/44.
Be sure no short on pins 5 & 18 of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, if you need to replace them.
Check first if =<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKLTCTRL</SIGNAL> arrives to <RESISTOR>R7743</RESISTOR>/44...

threads.message: Im getting 5v on both those resistors <RESISTOR>R7743</RESISTOR>/4 both 2.5Ohms and both are 0.374 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: There is nothing wrong with the driver you said you have 0.003 with the screen connected but it 1.1 without. Replace the blown fuse and measure again with a KNOWN GOOD screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message:
"J8300 P1 with lcd on is 0.033 Diode mode
J8300 P1 w/o lcd is 1.149 Diode mode"
Ooops, I didn't read this full.
You have LCD assemblw problem; video cable, or display itself (more probably).

But confirm again all measurments, because you posted 0V on pins 5 & 18 of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> first time and 5V next post.
Always measure voltages with LCD connected.
Please provide accurate information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: What fuse?. i said i had 12v on both sides. the fuse F7700 is fine unless you are referring to another one. ill try another screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: My apologies i measured <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> with the machine off. the second measurement was with machine on. thanks am getting a screen now. will update in the next hour. both pins 5 and 18 are getting 5v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight image can be seen liquid damaged.
threads.message: Thanks for your help guys. it was the screen after all. Oh well i guess i better ring the customer and tell him the bad news.
